meanings.sent1: The birds tweedles in the morning.
meanings.sent2: She tweedles a happy tune while walking.
meanings.sent3: The little chick tweedles to greet its mother.
meanings.sent4: The wind tweedles through the leaves like a gentle melody.
meanings.sent5: His flute tweedles a sweet song that fills the air.

meanings.definition: A series of high-pitched, chirping sounds
meanings.sent1: The tweedles of the birds filled the forest.
meanings.sent2: She heard the tweedles of crickets in the night.
meanings.sent3: The tweedles of the baby birds made her smile.
meanings.sent4: The tweedles of the wind sounded like tiny bells.
meanings.sent5: The tweedles of the stream added to the peaceful atmosphere.

meanings.definition: To produce a series of high-pitched, chirping sounds
meanings.sent1: The cricket tweedles all night long.
meanings.sent2: She tweedles a lullaby to soothe the baby.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tweedles happily while gathering nuts.
meanings.sent4: The flute tweedles a cheerful tune in the park.
meanings.sent5: The bird tweedles a welcome as the sun rises.
